data.title: GREAT SMALL TOWN MUSEUM
data.text: Being a 16 year Navy veteran, i really enjoyed this museum..they have exhibits from all conflicts..worth the time to see.

data.title: From the Civil War to Iraq
data.text: AwWell-displayed tour of each war, with artifacts, uniforms, weapons & photographs. A history-buff could easily spend hours.

data.title: Get the dog tags
data.text: Get the dog tags and visit the different time periods to read your role in them.  My grandsons really enjoy this aspect of the museum, but there is something for everyone including planetarium shows and a separate building has the Imaginarium, a hands on science experience for youth.  There is also a historic house to visit.  Exhibits change periodically, so going back is a new experience.

data.title: A HIGHLY WELL DONE MUSEUM!
data.text: We planned a visit here because of the Sullivan Brothers museum, but then discovered all the OTHER fine and interesting exhibits under the same roof! You don't have to spend half a day in this museum, but you may easily be tempted to! We did. Very friendly staff, and a nice gift shop. Parking was a bit tricky and confined, but if you go in the morning it'll be okay. Truly a fun museum . . . and inspiring. Go there.

data.title: Iowa Veterans museum, and Grout an over-all historical museum
data.text:
Grout and Iowa Veterans Museum. Has two parts, Iowa Veterans museum, and Grout an over-all historical museum for Waterloo, Iowa and the area. Both are good only the veteran part is new and more up to date.
  
The Veterans Museum starts with wars in this order Civil War, Spanish American War, World War 1, World War 2, Korea, Vietnam War, and last Current Conflicts. I was looking for Mexican–American War/Period nothing on this war this was just the founding of Iowa. 

All of the wars covered in the same way home front and theater of the war. Do like the way they did it very good and interesting. Know this was centered on Iowa. In the center of the display covering WW2 from before the USA was in WW2 to the end. Is a very good historical map table. Think it should have had some on the eastern front during and at the end of WW2.   
Very good I think you should go.

data.title: Wonderful
data.text: Great place to read about various wars, Iowan's who participated, Iowa companies that provided support, etc.  Great interactive exhibits, videos, displays, etc.  A planetarium is also in the museum but we missed the presentation.  There is also a great history of the Waterloo area.  Well worth the visit.

data.title: Wonderful
data.text: Great place to visit. Went there thinking we would spend an hour & were there 3 hours!!! Didn't realize this was included in the Grout museum!! The Veitnam display was there when we were there. Awesome & informative!!

data.title: Good staff, good exhibits
data.text:
As a Navy veteran I am always excited when I come across anything Navy-related.

The story of the Sullivan brothers is one all should know.  You can read it, you can see the movie but to visit this museum is worth the time in my view.

I watched the short movie in their theatre, look at all the exhibits on the veterans side of this tri-museum and enjoyed the main entrance exhibits, especially the Lone Sailor out front.

I would highly recommend this for people who enjoy seeing some of the conditions and equipment of wars going back well over a 100 years.

Veterans get in for $5 and it is only $10 for others.

data.title: Well worth the visit
data.text: This museum should make anyone get a better understanding of what our military has done over the years.  Videos, interactives and great displays.  Very nice helpful staff.  Proud to say they have accepted some artifacts of my fathers from WWII.  A must see for all that are old enough to appreciate and understand.

data.title: It's not really for kids
data.text: It's a nice museum. Lots to read and learn. It really isn't for kids. They got bored very easy. There wasn't much for them to do which made it hard for us to read all the materials we wanted to.

data.title: Very impressive
data.text: What a well put together museum! A great mix of interactive options and displays to read and look at. Videos are set up with motion detectors,  and there is bench seating wherever there are videos. Took in the planetarium show which lasted not quite an hour. You sure can tell the care,  time,  and pride that went in to creating the exhibits and honoring veterans.

data.title: A museum worth visiting
data.text: This museum is interactive, modern and well thought out. It tells great stories in a way that's engaging for audiences of all ages. It's not a dusty basement full of "old stuff" like so many military museums.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Great place to take your grandchildren. My husband is a Vietnam vet and he really enjoyed it. The displays were awesome.

data.title: Great museum
data.text: The museum has a very good layout, and some very interesting displays.  As a veteran, I was impressed with the presentations. I definitely recommend this to anyone with an interest in our military past.

data.title: Impressive Museum
data.text:
We just got back from visiting this wonderful museum in Waterloo, IA yesterday.  It really is a first-rate museum.  The building is beautiful.  You are given a dogtag that you scan at various stations to learn about what may have happened to you during various wars (I died of influenza in WWI which by simple statistics was probably correct).
The story of the Sullivan brothers it detailed nicely in a movie at the beginning of the exhibits.  Then one walks through the museum and views how Iowa was involved in various US wars over time.
In particular the Civil war had an outstanding interactive station to see various battle locations on a map and hear about the progress of the war...well worth the time to listen to that.
WWII has a similar interactive station but is a huge table map of the world with lights and video that tells the story of the war with engaging methods.
Throughout there is reference to the sacrifices that Iowans and others have made defending our country.

data.title: Well worth a visit for American History Buffs
data.text:
Even though I'm a history buff, I'm not overly interested in battles and military strategy.  This museum gives informative yet concise and understandable information about the US wars since the Civil War.  There is some specific Iowa info, but it is a great historic overview of all our wars.  I would definitely recommend for most.
One of my favorite features was an illuminated map showing the movement of the war.  The map lights up as the narration moves through the various stages until the end of the war.  There was one of these for most of the wars featured.  Very helpful!

data.title: Great visit
data.text: I took my 11 year old son to the museum for a mother son date and I made one big mistake...I didn't allow enough time. We were there for 1 1/2 hours and when it was time to leave, I had a disappointed son. We will be going back.

data.title: very nice
data.text: went ta wedding reception food was very good the workers were nice but the place could use some up datting

data.title: A stroll through the past.
data.text: If you don't know the Sullivan Brothers are from Waterloo.  If you are a WWII buff this is a must see museum.  If you don't know who the Sullivan Brothers are do your home work then come to Waterloo.

data.title: Great history lesson
data.text: What a great attraction to visit and to learn all about the 5 Sullivan Brothers.  Our kids loved the visit.
